Chemical reactions involve reorganization of atoms. These are neither created not destroyed in
a chemical reaction.

When gases combine or reproduced in a chemical reactionn they do so in a simple ratio by
volume provided all gases are the same T & P.

point $${l \over 4}$$ away from the centre of the rod,
and perpendicular to it, is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:

point $${l \over 4}$$ away from the centre of the rod,
and perpendicular to it, is :

questions.question_text:
A polarizer - analyser set is adjusted such that the intensity of light coming out of the analyser is just 10% of the original intensity. Assuming that the polarizer - analyser set does not absorb any light, the angle by which the analyser need to be rotated further to reduce the output intensity to be
zero, is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A polarizer - analyser set is adjusted such that the intensity of light coming out of the analyser is just 10% of the original intensity. Assuming that the polarizer - analyser set does not absorb any light, the angle by which the analyser need to be rotated further to reduce the output intensity to be
zero, is :

questions.question_text: Consider a circular coil of wire carrying constant current I, forming a magnetic dipole. The magnetic flux through an infinite plane that contains the circular coil and excluding the circular coil area is given by $$\phi $$i. The magnetic flux through the area of the circular coil area is given by $$\phi $$0. Which of the following option is correct?
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Consider a circular coil of wire carrying constant current I, forming a magnetic dipole. The magnetic flux through an infinite plane that contains the circular coil and excluding the circular coil area is given by $$\phi $$_{i}. The magnetic flux through the area of the circular coil area is given by $$\phi $$_{0}. Which of the following option is correct?

questions.question_text:
A 60 HP electric motor lifts an elevator having a maximum total load capacity of 2000 kg. If the frictional force on the elevator is 4000 N, the speed of the elevator at full load is close to : 
(1 HP = 746 W, g = 10 ms-2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A 60 HP electric motor lifts an elevator having a maximum total load capacity of 2000 kg. If the frictional force on the elevator is 4000 N, the speed of the elevator at full load is close to : (1 HP = 746 W, g = 10 ms^{-2})

questions.question_text:
A loop ABCDEFA of straight edges has six corner points A(0, 0, 0), B(5, 0, 0), C(5, 5, 0), D (0, 5,
0), E(0, 5, 5) and F(0, 0, 5). The magnetic field in this region is $$\overrightarrow B  = \left( {3\widehat i + 4\widehat k} \right)T$$
. The quantity of
flux through the loop ABCDEFA (in Wb) is _______.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A loop ABCDEFA of straight edges has six corner points A(0, 0, 0), B(5, 0, 0), C(5, 5, 0), D (0, 5,
0), E(0, 5, 5) and F(0, 0, 5). The magnetic field in this region is $$\overrightarrow B  = \left( {3\widehat i + 4\widehat k} \right)T$$
. The quantity of
flux through the loop ABCDEFA (in Wb) is _______.

questions.question_text: Visible light of wavelength 6000 $$ \times $$ 10-8 cm falls normally on a single slit and produces a diffraction pattern. It is found that the second diffraction minimum is at 60o from the central maximum. If the first minimum is produced at $$\theta $$1, then $$\theta $$1, is close to :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Visible light of wavelength 6000 $$ \times $$ 10^{-8} cm falls normally on a single slit and produces a diffraction pattern. It is found that the second diffraction minimum is at 60^{o} from the central maximum. If the first minimum is produced at $$\theta $$_{1}, then $$\theta $$_{1}, is close to :

questions.question_text:

 5 $$ \times $$ 10-5/oC along the x-axis and 5 $$ \times $$ 10-6/oC along the y and the z-axis. If the coefficient of volume expansion of the solid is C $$ \times $$ 10-6/oC then the value of C is

questions.question_text: Three point particles of masses 1.0 kg, 1.5 kg and 2.5 kg are placed at three corners of a right angle triangle of sides 4.0 cm, 3.0 cm and 5.0 cm as shown in the figure. The center of mass of the system is at a point:
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: 2.0 cm right and 0.9 cm above 1 kg mass
options.B: 0.9 cm right and 2.0 cm above 1 kg mass
options.C: 0.6 cm right and 2.0 cm above 1 kg mass
options.D: 1.5 cm right and 1.2 cm above 1 kg mass
